title: Is league mostly about individual skill or Team Play?
body:
Hello People,

I'm asking this question because I think I have a misconception about how the game is played. I see a lot of people playing for self or with there friends worrying about their K/D ratio. I played like this for a long time until I started watching Ranked matches. It seems that at the end of the day to move up in rank all that matters is that your team wins, Is this true? Even if you are doing very well for yourself within the match if your team loses you lose points. Does individual skill play a part in determining your ranking? And if it doesn't why are their people playing for self?

replies.body: Its about using your personal skill to benefit the team

> [{quoted}](name=TheXtractor,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aATjwEcq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-10T13:30:17.834+0000)
>
> Its about using your personal skill to benefit the team

This sums it up perfectly - doesn't matter how hard you win lane if you can't team fight.
Normals for self, ranked for team

I used to play brass in an orchestra. My instructor told me something regarding practicing that I will never forget. Always practice as if your at a concert even when you're by yourself. By your logic you will inadvertently train for self rather than team.
^True, but lets not forget that teams have tryouts - you need to be your best to play on the team. That's how I view League - normals are to better your skills, ranked is where you test them.
Soloqueue is mostly individual skill, but your individual skill relies heavily on how well you work with varying types of teams.

Soloque is about which team has more luck. If youre team is lucky enough you will have an ADC who crits every hit. You can be on purple side if youre lucky enough. There will have less people disconnecting on your team while on a lucky team. 

Of course you need skill to make sure you dont lose lane and get ahead. Your team might even get ahead, but once the enemy team gets lucky enough theyll win.
If you are going into ranked games its best to bring a friend along.

It's a balance. You can carry a sub-par team if you are good enough, but if your team really sucks, not much you can do.

Plus, we all have bad games. Sometimes you need your team to carry you.
